parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular

str2: When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From pros and a probable derivative of kuon; to fawn or crouch to, i.e. prostrate oneself in homage.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A mountain, hill. Probably from an obsolete oro; a mountain: -hill, mount(-ain).
And not, neither, nor. From ou and te; not too, i.e. Neither or nor; by analogy, not even.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The Greek form of the Hebrew name: Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Hierosolyma
